00029 from Koo.Common import Common
00030 from Koo import Rpc

00037 ## @brief The FormContainer class is a widget with some functionalities to help
00038 # the parser construct a Form.
00039 class FormContainer( QWidget ):
00040         def __init__(self, parent=None, maxColumns=4):
00041                 QWidget.__init__(self, parent)
00042                 self.row = 0
00043                 self.column = 0
00044                 self.layout = QGridLayout( self )
00045                 self.layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00046                 self.layout.setVerticalSpacing( 0 )
00047                 self.layout.setAlignment( Qt.AlignTop )
00048                 self.maxColumns = maxColumns
00049                 self.isTab = False
00050                 self.tabWidget = parent
00051 
00052         def setTabEnabled(self, value):
00053                 self.tabWidget.setTabEnabled( self.tabWidget.indexOf( self ), value )
00054 
00055         def showHelp(self, link):
00056                 QApplication.postEvent( self.sender(), QEvent( QEvent.WhatsThis ) )
00057 
00058         def addWidget(self, widget, attributes={}, labelText=None):
00059                 colspan = int(attributes.get( 'colspan', 1 ))
00060                 helpText = attributes.get( 'help', False )
00061                 stylesheet = attributes.get( 'stylesheet', False )
00062 
00063                 if colspan > self.maxColumns:
00064                         colspan = self.maxColumns
00065                         
00066                 a = labelText and 1 or 0
00067                 colspan -= a
00068                 colspan = max(colspan, 1)
00069                 if colspan + self.column + a  > self.maxColumns:
00070                         self.newRow()
00071 
00072                 if labelText:
00073                         label  = QLabel( self )
00074                         label.setText( unicode( Common.normalizeLabel( labelText ) ) )
00075                         label.setAlignment( Qt.AlignRight | Qt.AlignVCenter )
00076                         label.setSizePolicy( QSizePolicy.Fixed, QSizePolicy.Fixed )
00077                         if helpText:
00078                                 helpText = '<b>%s</b><br/>%s' % (labelText, helpText)
00079                                 label.setText( unicode( '<small><a href="help">?</a></small> ' + labelText ) )
00080                                 label.setToolTip( helpText )
00081                                 label.setWhatsThis( helpText )
00082                                 widget.setWhatsThis( helpText )
00083                                 self.connect( label, SIGNAL('linkActivated(QString)'), self.showHelp )
00084 
00085                         self.layout.addWidget( label, self.row, self.column )
00086                         self.column = self.column + 1
00087 
00088                 self.layout.addWidget( widget, self.row, self.column, 1, colspan )
00089 
00090                 if stylesheet:
00091                         widget.setStyleSheet( stylesheet )
00092                 self.column += colspan
00093 
00094         def newRow(self):
00095                 self.row = self.row + 1
00096                 self.column = 0
00097 
00098 ## @brief The FormView class is an AbstractView capable of showing one in an read-write form.
00099 class FormView( AbstractView ):
00100         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00101                 AbstractView.__init__( self, parent )
00102                 # We still depend on the parent being a screen because of ButtonFormWidget
00103                 self.screen = parent
00104                 self.title = ""
00105                 self.record = None
00106                 self._readOnly = False
00107 
00108                 self.layout = QHBoxLayout( self )
00109                 self.layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00110                 self.layout.setAlignment( Qt.AlignTop )
00111 
00112                 # The parser will include all the widgets here with {name: widget} structure
00113                 self.widgets = {}
00114                 # The parser will include here all widgets that can change their state (such as visibility).
00115                 # This can include field widgets but also tabs, and others.
00116                 self.stateWidgets = []
00117 
00118         def viewType(self):
00119                 return 'form'
00120 
00121         def setWidget(self, widget):
00122                 self.widget = widget
00123                 self.layout.addWidget( self.widget, 10 )
00124 
00125         def __getitem__(self, name):
00126                 return self.widgets[name]
00127         
00128         def store(self):
00129                 if not self.record:
00130                         return
00131                 
00132                 for name in self.widgets:
00133                         if self.widgets[name].record:
00134                                 self.widgets[name].store()
00135                         else:
00136                                 # TODO: Why should this happen?
00137                                 print "NO MODEL SET FOR WIDGET: ", name
00138 
00139         def selectedRecords(self):
00140                 if self.record:
00141                         return [self.record]
00142                 return []
00143 
00144         def reset(self):
00145                 for name, widget in self.widgets.items():
00146                         widget.reset()
00147 
00148         def display(self, currentRecord, records):
00149                 # Though it might seem it's not necessary to connect FormView to recordChanged signal it
00150                 # actually is. This is due to possible 'on_change' events triggered by the modification of
00151                 # a field. This forces those widgets that might change the record before a 'lostfocus' has been
00152                 # triggered to ensure the view has saved all its fields. As an example, modifying a char field
00153                 # and pressing the new button of a OneToMany widget might trigger a recordChanged before 
00154                 # char field has actually changed the value in the record. After updateDisplay, char field will
00155                 # be reset to its previous state. Take a look at OneToMany implementation to see what's needed
00156                 # in such buttons.
00157                 if self.record:
00158                         self.disconnect(self.record,SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'),self.updateDisplay)
00159                 self.record = currentRecord
00160                 if self.record:
00161                         self.connect(self.record, SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'),self.updateDisplay)
00162                 self.updateDisplay(self.record)
00163 
00164         def updateDisplay(self, record):
00165 
00166                 # Update data on widgets
00167                 for name in self.widgets:
00168                         self.widgets[name].setReadOnly( False )
00169                         if self.record:
00170                                 self.widgets[name].load(self.record)
00171                         else:
00172                                 self.widgets[name].load(None)
00173 
00174                 # Update state widgets
00175                 for widget in self.stateWidgets:
00176                         # Consider 'attrs' attribute
00177                         for attribute, condition in widget['attributes'].iteritems():
00178                                 if self.record:
00179                                         value = self.record.evaluateCondition( condition )
00180                                 else:
00181                                         value = False
00182                                 if attribute == 'invisible':
00183                                         self.setWidgetVisible( widget['widget'], not value )
00184                                 elif attribute == 'readonly':
00185                                         self.setWidgetReadOnly( widget['widget'], value )
00186                         # Consider 'states' attribute
00187                         if widget['states']:
00188                                 if self.record and self.record.fieldExists('state'):
00189                                         state = self.record.value('state')
00190                                 else:
00191                                         state = ''
00192                                 if state in widget['states']:
00193                                         self.setWidgetVisible( widget['widget'], True )
00194                                 else:
00195                                         self.setWidgetVisible( widget['widget'], False )
00196 
00197                 if self._readOnly:
00198                         for name in self.widgets:
00199                                 self.widgets[name].setReadOnly( True )
00200 
00201         def setWidgetVisible(self, widget, value):
00202                 # We need to know if the widget is a FormContainer and it's the
00203                 # main widget in a tab in which case we'll want to disable
00204                 # the whole tab (we can't hide it because Qt doesn't provide an
00205                 # easy way of doing it).
00206                 if isinstance(widget, FormContainer) and widget.isTab:
00207                         widget.setTabEnabled( value )
00208                 else:
00209                         widget.setVisible( value )
00210 
00211         def setWidgetReadOnly(self, widget, value):
00212                 # We need to know if the widget is a FormContainer and it's the
00213                 # main widget in a tab in which case we'll want to disable
00214                 # the whole tab 
00215                 if isinstance(widget, FormContainer) and widget.isTab:
00216                         widget.setTabEnabled( not value )
00217                 else:
00218                         widget['widget'].setReadOnly( value )
00219 
00220         def addStateWidget(self, widget, attributes, states):
00221                 if not attributes:
00222                         attributes = "{}"
00223                 attributes = eval( attributes )
00224                 if states:
00225                         states = states.split(',')
00226                 else:
00227                         states = []
00228                 self.stateWidgets.append({
00229                         'widget': widget,
00230                         'attributes': attributes,
00231                         'states': states
00232                 })
00233 
00234         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00235                 self._readOnly = value
00236 
00237         def viewSettings(self):
00238                 splitters = self.findChildren( QSplitter )
00239                 data = QByteArray()
00240                 stream = QDataStream( data, QIODevice.WriteOnly )
00241                 for x in splitters:
00242                         stream << x.saveState()
00243                 for x in sorted( self.widgets.keys() ):
00244                         stream << self.widgets[x].saveState()
00245                 return str( data.toBase64() )
00246 
00247         def setViewSettings(self, settings):
00248                 if not settings:
00249                         return
00250                 splitters = self.findChildren( QSplitter )
00251                 data = QByteArray.fromBase64( settings )
00252                 stream = QDataStream( data )
00253                 for x in splitters:
00254                         if stream.atEnd():
00255                                 return
00256                         value = QByteArray()
00257                         stream >> value
00258                         x.restoreState( value )
00259                 for x in sorted( self.widgets.keys() ):
00260                         if stream.atEnd():
00261                                 return
00262                         value = QByteArray()
00263                         stream >> value
00264                         self.widgets[x].restoreState( value )
00265 
00266         def showsMultipleRecords(self):
00267                 return False
